Subject: species O2 not concerved in NO + O2  <=> N + O + O2 ?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=272211370; y=paVRHp0iMDOKlJE8kUBSo7eqvmelUFO7nHrhSpRwDneBHg
X-Yahoo-Profile: robikar

Dear Cantera Users,

We are testing the code and use just one reaction step=
:

reaction( "NO + O2  <=3D> N + O + O2",    [7.95000E+20, -2.0, 251.0*300]=
)

Solving with

gas.setState_TPX(2400., OneAtm, "O2:0.2 O:0.2 N2:0.2 N:0.2=
 NO:0.2");

and advancing in time

for (int i =3D 1; i <=3D nsteps; i++) {
=
        tm =3D i*dt;
        r.advance(tm);
        saveSoln(tm, gas, soln)=
;
}

gives us that species O2 not conserved.

Where the problem comes from =
? 

Are you forcing some mass conservation in the iteration process and
thi=
s gives unphysical solutions ?

Thank you, Robert.
